full_text: BE] 4 : 2016/KER/42461 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN V TUESDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF OCTOBER 2016/12TH ASWINA, 1938 Cri.MC.No. 5407 of 2016 () CC.NO. 1170/2013 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-I, CHERTHALA CRIME NO. 524/2013 OF PATTANAKKAD POLICE STATION, ALAPPUZHA DISTRICT PETITIONER/ACCUSED : NISHAD, AGED 32 YEARS, S/O. ABUBACKER, MADAVANACHIRA, VADUTHALA JETTY. P.O., CHERTHALA, ALAPUZHA. BY ADVS.SRILABDUL JALEEL.A SMT.M.A.SULFIA RESPONDENT/COMPLAINANT: STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT, REPRESENTED BY SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, PATTANAKKAD PS, CHERTHALA, ALAPPUZHA DISTRICT. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.M.R.DHANIL THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 04-10-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: sts BE] 4 : 2016/KER/42461 Cri.MC.No. 5407 of 2016 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES: ANNEXURE A1: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIR AND FINAL REPORT FILED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, PATTANAKKADU POLICE STATION ANNEXURE A2: ATRUE COPYOF THE JUDGMENT IN WPC NO.26779/2013 DATED 28.08.2013. ANNEXURE A3: ATRUE COPY OF THE PAYMENT RECEIPT DATED 26.09.2013 RESPONDENT(S) ANNEXURES: NIL /TRUE COPY/ P.A.TO JUDGE sts eae 2016/KER/42461 RAJA VIJTAYARAGHAVAN, V., J. Dated this the 4 day of October, 2016 ORDER 1.The petitioner is the first accused in C.C.No.1170 of 2013 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I, Cherthala. He is being proceeded against for having committed offence punishable under Section 21 of the Mines and Mineral (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957 and Section 118(e) of the Kerala Police Act read with Section 34 of the IPC. 2.The learned counsel appearing for the petitioner submits that by Annexure-A2 judgment in W.P.(C) No.26779 of 2013, the petitioner herein was permitted to file an application before the respondent and seek for eae 2016/KER/42461 Cri.M.C. No. 5407 of 2016 ~2- compounding the offence and the respondent was also directed to pass orders in compliance with the directions in Digil v. Sub Inspector of Police [2013(1) KLT 600]. In pursuance to Annexure-A2 judgment, a sum of Rs.25,000/- was remitted towards compounding fee which is evidenced by Annexure-A3 and the offence was compounded. According to the learned counsel, in view of the decision of this Court in Digil v. Sub Inspector of Police (supra), when compounding fee has been collected and the vehicle has been released, no further proceedings can be taken in respect of the offence under the MMDR Act. 3.In view of the above, insofar as the offence under Section 21 of the Mines and Mineral (Development Regulation) Act, 1957 is concerned, the prosecution cannot be sustained. However, the criminal proceedings under Section 118(e) of the Kerala Police Act read with Section CER Pe) 2 tai 2016/KER/42461 Cri.M.C. No. 5407 of 2016 ~3- 34 of the IPC shall continue unabated against the petitioner and others. Petition is disposed of. Sd/- RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN, V. JUDGE Ps/4/10/16
